program.name: Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC)
program.description_short: Food and nutrition help for pregnant and breastfeeding people and for families with children under 5 years of age.
program.description:
Food and nutrition help for pregnant and breastfeeding people and for families with children under 5 years of age.

WIC provides healthy food, breastfeeding help, nutrition information, and more. Pregnant people and children under 5 years of age may qualify. New moms may qualify if they had a baby in the last 6 months or are breastfeeding a child under 1.

WIC helps you buy fruits and vegetables, whole grains, iron-rich foods, milk, cheese, yogurt, baby formula, and more. At your intake appointment, a professional will screen you and your children for a medical or nutritional health risk.

The time to apply includes your enrollment appointment. You should expect a phone call within 3 business days after you submit your application. On average, it may take between 1 and 3 weeks to receive this benefit. Income limits apply.
program.website_description: Food / breastfeeding help for pregnant women and families with children under 5

documents.text: Proof of home address (ex: lease, mortgage statement, utility bill)
Proof of unearned income (ex: child support, social security, unemployment)
Evidence of participation in a qualifying benefits program (if applicable)
Proof of earned income  (ex: pay stubs, tax returns, W-2, 1099) & employer information
Proof of identity (ex: driver's license, official state ID card)
